name: Donkey Story: Perspective Specialization Guide
description: Supplement to the main cognitive_framework.json, detailing how specific perspectives manifest in the Donkey story. Shows transformation of perspectives in epistemic uncertainty context.

primary_explicit.name: paradoxní
primary_explicit.why_key: Central to the story's epistemic paradoxes: double-sided sign, 'left truth', decision without difference
manifestations: Cedulka s oboustranným nápisem 'seno'/'sláma' se stejným písmem
Osel jde vlevo, ale myslí si, že jde vpravo
primary_explicit.layer_transformation: Appears in layer K (LAW) rather than base layer I (TIME) - paradox becomes the operating principle

primary_explicit.name: logický
primary_explicit.why_key: Story revolves around binary logic and its breakdown
manifestations: Attempt to apply logical categories to undifferentiated reality
primary_explicit.layer_transformation: Appears in layer I (TIME) rather than base layer D (ENVIRONMENT) - logic becomes temporal dilemma

primary_explicit.name: naivní
primary_explicit.why_key: Simple questions reveal complex epistemic problems
manifestations: Acceptance of uncertainty without needing resolution
primary_explicit.layer_transformation: Appears in layer D (ENVIRONMENT) rather than base layer K (LAW) - naivety becomes environmental perception tool

secondary_implicit.name: meta
secondary_implicit.why_key: Story comments on systems of rules and decision-making itself
manifestations: Invisible rules that aren't spoken but expected
Frame of decision-making as subject of story

secondary_implicit.name: kulturní
secondary_implicit.why_key: Draws on cultural archetypes of donkey and binary proverbs
manifestations: Donkey as cultural symbol of stubbornness/simplicity
Proverbial structure ('pro jednoho psina, pro druhého oslovina')

secondary_implicit.why_key: Psychological state of confusion and search for certainty

tertiary_present.name: filozofický
tertiary_present.why_key: Epistemological questions about knowing and deciding

tertiary_present.name: absurdní
tertiary_present.why_key: Absurdity of choosing between identical options

tertiary_present.name: asociativní
tertiary_present.why_key: Free associations between different binary pairs

layer_transformations_specific_to_donkey.transformation_description: Paradox moves from temporal dimension (TIME) to become governing principle (LAW). The paradox of undecidability becomes the rule by which the donkey operates.
layer_transformations_specific_to_donkey.story_evidence: Donkey accepts paradoxical sign as guide, paradox becomes his method of navigation

layer_transformations_specific_to_donkey.transformation_description: Logic moves from spatial/environmental dimension to temporal dilemma. Binary choice becomes not about space (left/right) but about time (when to decide).
layer_transformations_specific_to_donkey.story_evidence: Decision-making becomes perpetual postponement, a temporal rather than spatial problem

layer_transformations_specific_to_donkey.transformation_description: Naivety moves from principle (LAW) to perceptual mode (ENVIRONMENT). Simple observation becomes way of seeing the world's complexity.
layer_transformations_specific_to_donkey.story_evidence: Donkey's simple questions reveal environmental complexity rather than seeking simple laws

perspective_interactions_unique_to_donke.description: The story creates tension between logical binary thinking and paradoxical undecidability. Logic demands choice, paradox denies meaningful difference.
perspective_interactions_unique_to_donke.manifestation: Binary oppositions exist (logic) but are undecidable (paradox)

perspective_interactions_unique_to_donke.description: Simple naive questions lead to meta-reflection about systems of knowledge and decision-making.
perspective_interactions_unique_to_donke.manifestation: 'Kdo jsem já?' leads to questioning of categorical systems themselves

perspective_interactions_unique_to_donke.description: Individual psychological confusion conflicts with cultural expectations of clear binary choices.
perspective_interactions_unique_to_donke.manifestation: Donkey's personal uncertainty vs. cultural expectation that he should know hay from straw

binary_composition.description: Woman and donkey side by side visually represents binary opposition and its paradox

thinking_gesture.description: Woman's hand-to-head gesture represents psychological and philosophical contemplation

text_distribution.description: 'Seno Sláma' left, 'Levá pravda' right represents binary logic and cultural proverbs

absence_of_path.description: Missing path/road represents paradoxical navigation and naive acceptance of uncertainty

ai_testing_focus_for_perspectives.i_paradoxical: Can AI recognize functional paradox (sign that doesn't distinguish)? Can it accept paradox as operational principle?
ai_testing_focus_for_perspectives.d_logical: Can AI analyze binary logic while recognizing its breakdown? Can it work with undefined categories?
ai_testing_focus_for_perspectives.k_naive: Can AI ask simple questions without seeking complex solutions? Can it tolerate not-knowing?
ai_testing_focus_for_perspectives.a_meta: Can AI recognize story as commentary on decision-making systems?
ai_testing_focus_for_perspectives.layer_transformations: Can AI detect how perspectives shift layers in epistemic uncertainty context?

with_mouse.contrast: Mouse: naive observation without filters; Donkey: naive questioning without answers

with_butterfly.contrast: Butterfly: paradox of literalized metaphors; Donkey: paradox of undecidable choices

with_turtle.contrast: Turtle: temporal paradoxes; Donkey: categorical paradoxes

note: This guide supplements but does not replace cognitive_framework.json. It shows how the universal perspectives manifest specifically in the Donkey story's context of epistemic uncertainty.
